pullRequest.title: Add support for -XX:+PrintCodeCache
pullRequest.bodyText:
When -XX:+PrintCodeCache is passed to the JVM or
TR_PrintCodeCacheUsage=1 is set, the following
code cache usage data will be shown when the JVM exits:
CodeCache: size=262144Kb used=454Kb max_used=457Kb free=261690Kb.
This implementation requires the code cache usage data
implemented in eclipse/omr#4743.
If TR_PrintCompMem is set, the above code cache usage
information will be shown as well.
Fixes #8184
Signed-off-by: Annabelle Huo Annabelle.Huo@ibm.com

nodes.bodyText:
Unless the VM needs to know about this, I would put this in another place.
Possible alternatives:

privateJITConfig
persistentInfo
JIT Options
Conceptually, -XX:+PrintCodeCache being an option, maybe creating a shadow JIT option (a bit in TR::Options) makes most sense here

afterCommit.message:
Add support for -XX:+PrintCodeCache

[skip ci]
This change parses `-XX:+PrintCodeCache` option
and sets it in the JITConfig. When `-XX:+PrintCodeCache` is
passed to the JVM, the following will be shown when the JVM exits.
`CodeCache: size=262144Kb used=454Kb max_used=457Kb free=261690Kb`.

This implementation requires the code cache usage data
implemented in eclipse/omr#4743.

If `TR_PrintCompMem` is set, the above code cache usage
information will be shown as well.

Fixes #8184

Signed-off-by: Annabelle Huo <Annabelle.Huo@ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: STARTSWITH_MATCH  should be replaced with EXACT_MATCH because somethink like -XX:+PrintCodeCachemmm should not be accepted

commit.message:
Add support for -XX:+PrintCodeCache

When `-XX:+PrintCodeCache` is passed to the JVM or
`TR_PrintCodeCacheUsage=1` is set, the following
code cache usage data will be shown when the JVM exits:

`CodeCache: size=262144Kb used=454Kb max_used=457Kb free=261690Kb`.

This implementation requires the code cache usage data
implemented in eclipse/omr#4743.

If `TR_PrintCompMem` is set, the above code cache usage
information will be shown as well.

Fixes #8184

Signed-off-by: Annabelle Huo <Annabelle.Huo@ibm.com>
